intro: Stigmaphyllon lalandianum var. ciliolatum, commonly known as the ciliated stigmaphyllon, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ciliate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, moist forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
